Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in dismissing the refugee claim by ignoring evidence linking the applicants' risk to political affiliation
Outcome: Decision overturned, matter remitted for reconsideration
Evidence_Type: Evidence that applicants were targeted for selling PPP merchandise
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Existence of personal risk linked to Convention grounds
Regulation_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 96 and 97
Application_Error: Selective treatment of evidence, failure to recognize political nexus
Evidence_Ignored: Evidence linking targeting to sale of PPP merchandise and political affiliation
Legal_Standard: Risk must be linked to Convention grounds and not be merely generalized
Application_Factor: Personalized risk due to political opinion or association
Decision_Review_Issue: Failure to properly assess nexus between harm and political affiliation
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 96 and 97; Refugee Convention grounds
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived lack of nexus to Convention grounds
Evidentiary_Issues: Board ignored key evidence regarding political motivation for harm
Procedural_Fairness: Issue of whether decision-making process was fair given omission of relevant evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's interpretation and application of risk nexus under IRPA
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, sections 96 and 97
Procedural_Issue: Remittal for reassessment due to error in evaluation
